title.value: Adaptive Dynamic Programming for Energy-Efficient Base Station Cell Switching
title.justification: This is the exact title of the research paper provided.
title.quote: Adaptive Dynamic Programming for Energy-Efficient Base Station Cell Switching

extractions.description: This paper proposes an approximate dynamic programming (ADP)-based method coupled with online optimization to reduce energy consumption in wireless networks by switching base station cells on and off while maintaining adequate Quality of Service (QoS) metrics.

type.justification: The paper involves experiments conducted on a practical network simulator with various real-world scenarios to evaluate the performance of the proposed ADP method.
type.quote: Experiments conducted on a practical network simulator show that the proposed ADP method can achieve up to a 20.1% of power saving compared to baseline energy consumption.

name.justification: The paper focuses on energy-efficient techniques for base station cell switching in wireless networks, which is a key area in Computer Networks.
name.quote: Energy saving in wireless networks is growing in importance due to increasing demand for evolving new-gen cellular networks, environmental and regulatory concerns, and potential energy crises arising from geopolitical tensions.

name.justification: The main focus of the paper is on reducing energy consumption in base stations while maintaining QoS.
name.quote: To save the largest possible power consumption without deteriorating QoS, we include another MLP to predict QoS and a long short-term memory (LSTM) for predicting handovers.

name.justification: The paper leverages deep learning models like MLP and LSTM for power consumption and QoS estimations.
name.quote: We use a multilayer perceptron (MLP) given each state-action pair to predict the power consumption to approximate the value function in ADP ... included another MLP to predict QoS and a long short-term memory (LSTM) for predicting handovers.
